alert.note: Alert for Madera (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 10 at 11:11PM PST until March 11 at 1:30AM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR A DAM FLOODGATE RELEASE IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Hydrologic flooding caused by upstream dam release and high flows are expected. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following county, Madera. * WHEN...Until 700 AM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1109 PM PST, High flows and upstream floodgate releases are expected to cause minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Peckinpah, Crane Valley Reservoir, North Fork, Manzanita Lake, Willow Creek, and Bass Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
